original: Paṭṭhānapakaraṇa🔽Dhammānuloma (1), Dukatikapaṭṭhānapāḷi (3)
analyzed: paṭṭhāna pakaraṇa  dhamma anuloma
translated: The Book of Conditional Relations🔽In conformity with the ideas, The Triad-based text on conditions

original: 3.11. Upādānagocchaka, Kusalattika
analyzed: upādāna gocchaka kusalattika
translated: The one with clinging as its domain, The triad on the wholesome🔽…

original: 3.11.1.1–7. Paṭiccādivāra
translated: The section on direct assertion, etc.

original: Paccayacatukka
analyzed: paccaya catukka
translated: The fourfold section on conditions

original: Noupādānaṁ kusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca noupādāno kusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: no upādānam kusalam dhammam paṭicca no upādānaḥ kusalaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta
translated: With non-clinging as condition, a wholesome idea arises, a condition by way of condition. (In brief.)

original: Hetuyā ekaṁ, ārammaṇe ekaṁ …pe… avigate ekaṁ. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetuyā eka ārammaṇe ekaṃ pe avigate eka saṅkhitta
translated: In the causal, one; in the object, one; … in the unobscured, one. (In brief.)

original: (Sahajātavārepi …pe… pañhāvārepi sabbattha ekaṁ.)🔽Upādānaṁ akusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca upādāno akusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Upādānaṁ
analyzed: sahajāta vāre pi pe pañhā vāre pi sabbattha eka  upādānam akusalam dhammam paṭicca upādānaḥ akusalaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā upādāna
translated: (In the section on conascence, etc., and in the Question section, in each case one.)🔽With clinging as condition, an unwholesome idea arises, a condition by way of condition. With clinging as condition,

original: akusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca noupādāno akusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Upādānaṁ🔽akusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca upādāno akusalo ca noupādāno akusalo ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā.
analyzed: akusalam dhammam paṭicca no upādānaḥ akusalaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā upādāna  akusalam dhammam paṭicca upādānaḥ akusalo ca no upādānaḥ akusalo ca dhammā uppajjanti hetu paccayā
translated: an unwholesome idea arises, a condition by way of condition. With clinging as condition,🔽an unwholesome idea and an unwholesome idea with non-clinging as condition arise, a condition by way of condition.

original: Noupādānaṁ akusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca noupādāno akusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi.
analyzed: no upādānam akusalam dhammam paṭicca no upādānaḥ akusalaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi
translated: With non-clinging as condition, an unwholesome idea arises, a condition by way of condition. … three.

original: Upādānaṁ akusalañca noupādānaṁ akusalañca dhammaṁ paṭicca upādāno akusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: upādānam akusalañca no upādānam akusalañca dhammam paṭicca upādānaḥ akusalaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi
translated: With clinging as condition, an unwholesome state of clinging arises, by way of root cause condition … (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetuyā nava, ārammaṇe nava (sabbattha nava), avigate nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetuyā nava ārammaṇe nava sabbattha nava avigate nava
translated: (In the section on root cause, there are nine instances. In the sections on object, etc., there are nine instances in each section.) (Abbreviated.)

original: Noupādānaṁ akusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca noupādāno akusalo dhammo uppajjati nahetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: no upādānam akusalam dhammam paṭicca no upādānaḥ akusalaḥ dhammo uppajjati na hetu paccayā
translated: With an unwholesome state of clinging as condition, an unwholesome state of clinging arises, by way of non-root cause condition. (Abbreviated.)

original: Nahetuyā ekaṁ, naadhipatiyā nava, napurejāte nava …pe… nakamme tīṇi, navipāke nava, navippayutte nava.
analyzed: na hetuyā eka na adhipatiyā nava na purejāte nava pe na kamme tīṇi na vipāke nava na vippayutte nava
translated: (In the section on non-root cause, there is one instance. In the section on non-predominance, there are nine instances. In the section on non-conascence, there are nine instances. … In the section on kamma, there are three instances. In the section on non-result, there are nine instances. In the section on non-restraint, there are nine instances.)

original: Upādāno akusalo dhammo upādānassa akusalassa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Hetuyā nava, ārammaṇe nava, adhipatiyā nava (noupādānamūlake tīṇi, sahajātādhipati),
analyzed: upādānaḥ akusalaḥ dhammaḥ upādānassa akusalassa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ  hetuyā nava ārammaṇe nava adhipatiyā nava no upādāna mūlake tīṇi sahajāta adhipati
translated: An unwholesome state of clinging is a condition, by way of root cause condition, for an unwholesome state of clinging. (Abbreviated.)

original: anantare nava …pe… nissaye nava, upanissaye nava, āsevane nava, kamme tīṇi (noupādānamūlake),
analyzed: anantare nava pe nissaye nava upanissaye nava āsevane nava kamme tīṇi no upādāna mūlake
translated: (In the section on root cause, there are nine instances. In the section on object, there are nine instances. In the section on predominance, there are nine instances. (In the section on conascence, there are three instances. In the section on mutuality, there are three instances. In the section on support, there are three instances. In the section on nutriment, there are three instances. In the section on faculty, there are three instances. In the section on jhāna, there are three instances. In the section on path, there are three instances. In the section on association, there are three instances. In the section on dissociation, there are three instances. In the section on absence, there are three instances. In the section on presence, there are three instances.)🔽In the section on non-disappearance, there are three instances. In the section on disappearance, there are three instances. In the section on arising, there are three instances. In the section on presence, there are three instances. In the section on non-restraint, there are three instances. In the section on kamma, there are three instances. (In the section on result, there are three instances. In the section on nutriment, there are three instances. In the section on faculty, there are three instances. In the section on jhāna, there are three instances. In the section on path, there are three instances. In the section on association, there are three

original: āhāre tīṇi, indriye tīṇi, jhāne tīṇi, magge nava, sampayutte nava, atthiyā nava …pe…
analyzed: āhāre tīṇi indriye tīṇi jhāne tīṇi magge nava sampayutte nava atthiyā nava pe
translated: with respect to nutriment, there are three; with respect to the faculties, there are three; with respect to the jhānas, there are three; with respect to the paths, there are nine; with respect to the relations, there are nine; with respect to presence, there are nine.🔽(In brief.)

original: avigate nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Noupādānaṁ abyākataṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca noupādāno abyākato dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: a vigate nava saṅkhitta  no upādānam abyākatam dhammam paṭicca no upādānaḥ abyākataḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With respect to the unformed, there are nine.

original: Hetuyā ekaṁ, ārammaṇe ekaṁ …pe… avigate ekaṁ. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetuyā eka ārammaṇe ekaṃ pe avigate eka saṅkhitta
translated: With respect to the unformed, there are nine.🔽With respect to the unformed, there are nine.🔽(In brief.)

original: (Sahajātavārepi …pe… pañhāvārepi sabbattha ekaṁ.)
analyzed: sahajāta vāre pi pe pañhā vāre pi sabbattha eka
translated: (In the section on origination through a combination, …🔽in the section on the questions, too, in all cases there is one.)

original: 3.11.2.1. Kusalapada, Kusalattika
analyzed: kusala pada kusala ttika
translated: … the wholesome side, the wholesome triad

original: Hetu🔽Upādāniyaṁ kusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca upādāniyo kusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: hetu  upādāniyam kusalam dhammam paṭicca upādāniyaḥ kusalaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: Cause🔽With respect to the wholesome formed, there are two.🔽With respect to the wholesome formed, there are two.

original: Anupādāniyaṁ kusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca anupādāniyo kusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Hetuyā dve, ārammaṇe dve …pe… avigate dve.
analyzed: anupādāniyam kusalam dhammam paṭicca anupādāniyaḥ kusalaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta  hetuyā dve ārammaṇe dve pe avigate dve
translated: With respect to the wholesome formed, there are two.🔽With respect to the unwholesome formed, there are two.🔽With respect to the unwholesome formed, there are two.

original: Upādāniyaṁ akusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca upādāniyo akusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: upādāniyam akusalam dhammam paṭicca upādāniyaḥ akusalaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta
translated: With respect to the unwholesome formed, there are two.

original: Hetuyā ekaṁ, ārammaṇe ekaṁ …pe… avigate ekaṁ. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetuyā eka ārammaṇe ekaṃ pe avigate eka saṅkhitta
translated: … with cause as condition … … with object as condition … … with non-hindrance as condition … (In brief.)

original: (Sahajātavārepi …pe… pañhāvārepi sabbattha ekaṁ.)🔽Upādāniyaṁ abyākataṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca upādāniyo abyākato dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: sahajāta vāre pi pe pañhā vāre pi sabbattha eka  upādāniyam abyākatam dhammam paṭicca upādāniyaḥ abyākataḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: (In the section on origination, etc., and in the question section, there is one result in each triad.)🔽With an object that is a condition for clinging, a result that is a condition for clinging arises.

original: Anupādāniyaṁ abyākataṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca anupādāniyo abyākato dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: anupādāniyam abyākatam dhammam paṭicca anupādāniyaḥ abyākataḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With an object that is not a condition for clinging, a result that is not a condition for clinging arises.

original: Anupādāniyaṁ abyākataṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca upādāniyo abyākato dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: anupādāniyam abyākatam dhammam paṭicca upādāniyaḥ abyākataḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With an object that is not a condition for clinging, a result that is a condition for clinging arises.

original: Anupādāniyaṁ abyākataṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca upādāniyo abyākato ca anupādāniyo abyākato🔽ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā.
analyzed: anupādāniyam abyākatam dhammam paṭicca upādāniyaḥ abyākato ca anupādāniyaḥ abyākato  ca dhammā uppajjanti hetu paccayā
translated: With an object that is not a condition for clinging, a result that is a condition for clinging and a result that is not a condition for clinging arise.

original: Upādāniyaṁ abyākatañca anupādāniyaṁ abyākatañca dhammaṁ paṭicca upādāniyo abyākato dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: upādāniyam abyākatam ca anupādāniyam abyākatam ca dhammam paṭicca upādāniyaḥ abyākataḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With an object that is a condition for clinging and an object that is not a condition for clinging, a result that is a condition for clinging arises. (In brief.)

original: Hetuyā pañca, ārammaṇe dve …pe… āsevane ekaṁ …pe… avigate pañca.
analyzed: hetuyā pañca ārammaṇe dve pe āsevane ekam pe avigate pañca
translated: With cause as condition, there are five. With object as condition, there are two. … With nutriment as condition, there is one. … With non-hindrance as condition, there are five.

original: 3.11.3. Upādānasampayuttaduka, Kusalattika
translated: 3.11.3. The dyad connected with and disconnected from the fuels, the wholesome triad

original: Hetu
analyzed: hetu
translated: Cause

original: Upādānavippayuttaṁ kusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca upādānavippayutto kusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: upādāna vippayuttam kusalam dhammam paṭicca upādāna vippayuttaḥ kusalaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With a wholesome conditioned phenomenon that is disconnected from the fuels as condition, a wholesome conditioned phenomenon that is disconnected from the fuels arises, by way of cause condition. (In brief.)

original: Hetuyā ekaṁ, ārammaṇe ekaṁ …pe… avigate ekaṁ. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetuyā eka ārammaṇe ekaṃ pe avigate eka saṅkhitta
translated: In the cause, there is one. In the object, there is one. … In the unobscured, there is one. (In brief.)

original: (Sahajātavārepi …pe… pañhāvārepi sabbattha ekaṁ.)
analyzed: sahajāta vāre pi pe pañhā vāre pi sabbattha eka
translated: (In the section on conascence, etc., and in the question section, there is one in each triad.)

original: Upādānasampayuttaṁ akusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca upādānasampayutto akusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi.
analyzed: upādāna sampayuttam akusalam dhammam paṭicca upādāna sampayuttaḥ akusalaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi
translated: With a wholesome conditioned phenomenon that is connected with the fuels as condition, a wholesome conditioned phenomenon that is connected with the fuels arises, by way of cause condition. … there are three.

original: Upādānavippayuttaṁ akusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca upādānavippayutto akusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … dve.
analyzed: upādāna vippayuttam akusalam dhammam paṭicca upādāna vippayuttaḥ akusalaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā dve
translated: With a wholesome conditioned phenomenon that is disconnected from the fuels as condition, a wholesome conditioned phenomenon that is disconnected from the fuels arises, by way of cause condition. … there are two.

original: Upādānasampayuttaṁ akusalañca upādānavippayuttaṁ akusalañca dhammaṁ paṭicca upādānasampayutto akusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: upādāna sampayuttam akusalañca upādāna vippayuttam akusalañca dhammam paṭicca upādāna sampayuttaḥ akusalaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta
translated: With a wholesome conditioned phenomenon that is connected with the fuels and a wholesome conditioned phenomenon that is disconnected from the fuels as condition, a wholesome conditioned phenomenon that is connected with the fuels arises, by way of cause condition. (In brief.)

original: Hetuyā cha, ārammaṇe cha (sabbattha cha), avigate cha. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetuyā cha ārammaṇe cha sabbattha cha avigate cha saṅkhitta
translated: In the cause, there are six. In the object, there are six. (In all cases, six.) In the unobscured, there are six. (In brief.)

original: Nahetuyā ekaṁ, naadhipatiyā cha …pe… nakamme cattāri, navipāke cha, navippayutte cha.
analyzed: na hetuyā eka na adhipatiyā cha pe na kamme cattāri na vipāke cha na vippayutte cha
translated: With non-cause as condition, one … With non-decisive support as condition, six … With non-kamma as condition, four … With non-result as condition, six … With non-association as condition, six.

original: Upādānasampayutto akusalo dhammo upādānasampayuttassa akusalassa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo … tīṇi.
analyzed: upādāna sampayuttaḥ akusalaḥ dhammaḥ upādāna sampayuttassa akusalassa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ tīṇi
translated: An unwholesome state that is associated with clinging is a condition, as root-cause condition, for an unwholesome state that is associated with clinging. … There are three.

original: Upādānavippayutto akusalo dhammo upādānavippayuttassa akusalassa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo … dve.
analyzed: upādāna vippayuttaḥ akusalaḥ dhammaḥ upādāna vippayuttassa akusalassa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ dve
translated: An unwholesome state that is not associated with clinging is a condition, as root-cause condition, for an unwholesome state that is not associated with clinging. … There are two.

original: Upādānasampayutto akusalo ca upādānavippayutto akusalo ca dhammā upādānasampayuttassa akusalassa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: upādāna sampayuttaḥ akusalaḥ ca upādāna vippayuttaḥ akusalaḥ ca dhammā upādāna sampayuttassa akusalassa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: An unwholesome state that is associated with clinging and an unwholesome state that is not associated with clinging are a condition, as root-cause condition, for an unwholesome state that is associated with clinging. (In brief.)

translated: With the unwholesome root, greed, etc.

analyzed: hetu 🔽upādāniyam ca iva no ca upādānam kusalam dhammam paṭicca upādāniyaḥ ca iva no ca upādānaḥ kusalaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta 🔽hetuyā eka ārammaṇe ekaṃ pe avigate eka saṅkhitta 🔽sahajāta vāre pi pe pañhā vāre pi sabbattha eka
translated: With the

original: Upādānañceva upādāniyañca akusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca upādāno ceva upādāniyo ca akusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi.🔽Upādāniyañceva no ca upādānaṁ akusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca upādāniyo ceva no ca upādāno akusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi.
analyzed: upādānam ca iva upādāniyam ca akusalam dhammam paṭicca upādānaḥ ca iva upādāniyaḥ ca akusalaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi  upādāniyam ca iva no ca upādānam akusalam dhammam paṭicca upādāniyaḥ ca iva no ca upādānaḥ akusalaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi
translated: With an unwholesome state that is both a condition and a condition for clinging, there is the arising of an unwholesome state that is both a condition and a condition for clinging, by way of root cause condition. … There are three.🔽With an unwholesome state that is a condition for clinging but is not clinging, there is the arising of an unwholesome state that is a condition for clinging but is not clinging, by way of root cause condition. … There are three.

original: Upādānañceva upādāniyaṁ akusalañca upādāniyañceva no ca upādānaṁ akusalañca dhammaṁ paṭicca upādāno ceva upādāniyo ca akusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: upādānam ca iva upādāniyam akusalañca upādāniyam ca iva no ca upādānam akusalañca dhammam paṭicca upādānaḥ ca iva upādāniyaḥ ca akusalaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi
translated: With an unwholesome state that is both a condition and a condition for clinging and an unwholesome state that is a condition for clinging but is not clinging, there is the arising of an unwholesome state that is both a condition and a condition for clinging, by way of root cause condition. … There are three. (In brief.)

original: Hetuyā nava, ārammaṇe nava …pe… avigate nava.
analyzed: hetuyā nava ārammaṇe nava pe avigate nava
translated: With a cause, there are nine. With an object, there are nine. … With an absence of direct knowledge, there are nine.

original: Upādāniyañceva no ca upādānaṁ abyākataṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca upādāniyo ceva no ca upādāno abyākato dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: upādāniyam ca iva no ca upādānam abyākatam dhammam paṭicca upādāniyaḥ ca iva no ca upādānaḥ abyākataḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With an indeterminate state that is a condition for clinging but is not clinging, there is the arising of an indeterminate state that is a condition for clinging but is not clinging, by way of root cause condition. (In brief.)

original: Hetuyā ekaṁ, ārammaṇe ekaṁ …pe… avigate ekaṁ. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetuyā eka ārammaṇe ekaṃ pe avigate eka saṅkhitta
translated: With a cause, there is one. With an object, there is one. … With an absence of direct knowledge, there is one. (In brief.)

original: (Sahajātavārepi …pe… pañhāvārepi sabbattha ekaṁ.)
analyzed: sahajāta vāre pi pe pañhā vāre pi sabbattha eka
translated: (In the section on origination, etc., and in the questions, all are to be given in the same way as above.)

original: 3.11.5. Upādānaupādānasampayuttaduka, Kusalattika
translated: … With clinging and with that which is associated with clinging, the three triads beginning with the unprofitable

original: Hetu
analyzed: hetu
translated: Root-cause

original: Upādānañceva upādānasampayuttañca akusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca upādāno ceva upādānasampayutto ca akusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi.
analyzed: upādānam ca iva upādāna sampayuttam ca akusalam dhammam paṭicca upādānaḥ ca iva upādāna sampayuttaḥ ca akusalaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi
translated: With a root-cause that is a clinging and associated with clinging, an unprofitable idea arises with root-cause condition. … There are three.

original: Upādānasampayuttañceva no ca upādānaṁ akusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca upādānasampayutto ceva no ca upādāno akusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi.
analyzed: upādāna sampayuttam ca iva no ca upādānam akusalam dhammam paṭicca upādāna sampayuttaḥ ca iva no ca upādānaḥ akusalaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi
translated: With a root-cause that is associated with clinging but not a clinging, an unprofitable idea arises with root-cause condition. … There are three.

original: Upādānañceva upādānasampayuttaṁ akusalañca upādānasampayuttañceva no ca upādānaṁ🔽akusalañca dhammaṁ paṭicca upādāno ceva upādānasampayutto ca akusalo dhammo uppajjati
analyzed: upādānam ca iva upādāna sampayuttam akusalam ca upādāna sampayuttam ca iva no ca upādāna  akusalañca dhammam paṭicca upādāno ca iva upādāna sampayuttaḥ ca akusalaḥ dhammo uppajjati
translated: With a root-cause that is a clinging and associated with clinging, and with a root-cause that is associated with clinging but not a clinging,

original: hetupaccayā … tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetu paccayā tīṇi
translated: an unprofitable idea arises with root-cause condition. … There are three. (In brief)

original: Hetuyā nava, ārammaṇe nava, adhipatiyā nava …pe… avigate nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) (Imaṁ
analyzed: hetuyā nava ārammaṇe nava adhipatiyā nava pe avigate nava
translated: Nine with root-cause, nine with object, nine with predominance, etc. … nine with non-disappearance. (In brief) (The exposition should be given in the same way as in the section on the unprofitable.)🔽… With the unformed element, the four triads beginning with the profitable.

original: gamanaṁ upādānadukaakusalasadisaṁ. Idha pana hetupaccayā idaṁ nānaṁ. Sahajātavārepi
analyzed: gamanam upādāna duka akusala sadise idha pana hetu paccayāḥ idam sahajāta vāre pi
translated: The method of the section on going is similar to that of the unprofitable section on clinging. But here the difference in the case of the condition by way of cause is this. In the section on the conascent, etc.,

original: …pe… pañhāvārepi sabbattha nava.)
analyzed: pe pañhāvāre pi sabbattha nava
translated: … and in the question section, too, in all cases.

original: 3.11.6. Upādānavippayuttaupādāniyaduka, Kusalattika
translated: … Clinging-Free-From-Clinging-Constituent-With-Clinging-Constituent, the Wholesome Triad

original: Hetu🔽Upādānavippayuttaṁ upādāniyaṁ kusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca upādānavippayutto upādāniyo kusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: hetu  upādāna vippayuttam upādāniyam kusalam dhammam paṭicca upādāna vippayuttaḥ upādāniyaḥ kusalaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: Cause🔽With-clinging-constituent, clinging-free states, a wholesome consciousness, with-clinging-constituent, clinging-free, wholesome states as condition.

original: Upādānavippayuttaṁ anupādāniyaṁ kusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca upādānavippayutto anupādāniyo kusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Hetuyā dve, ārammaṇe dve …pe… avigate dve.
analyzed: upādāna vippayuttam anupādāniyam kusalam dhammam paṭicca upādāna vippayuttaḥ anupādāniyaḥ kusalaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta  hetuyā dve ārammaṇe dve pe avigate dve
translated: With-clinging-constituent, clinging-free, wholesome states, a wholesome consciousness, with-clinging-constituent, clinging-free, wholesome states as condition. (Abbreviated.)🔽In the case of the cause, there are two; in the case of the object, two; … in the case of the unincluded, two.🔽With-clinging-constituent, clinging-free, unprofitable states, a consciousness, with-clinging-constituent, clinging-free, unprofitable states as condition. (In all cases one.)

original: Upādānavippayuttaṁ upādāniyaṁ akusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca upādānavippayutto upādāniyo akusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Sabbattha ekaṁ.)
analyzed: upādāna vippayuttam upādāniyam akusalam dhammam paṭicca upādāna vippayuttaḥ upādāniyaḥ akusalaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā sabbattha eka
translated: With object-condition … (All four sections are to be elaborated.)

original: Upādānavippayuttaṁ upādāniyaṁ abyākataṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca upādānavippayutto upādāniyo abyākato dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: upādāna vippayuttam upādāniyam abyākatam dhammam paṭicca upādāna vippayuttaḥ upādāniyaḥ abyākataḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With an object that is unconnected and not connected to clinging, and is neutral, a state that is unconnected and not connected to clinging, and is neutral, arises. …🔽With an object that is unconnected and not connected to clinging, and is neutral, a state that is unconnected and not connected to clinging, and is neutral, arises. …

original: Upādānavippayuttaṁ anupādāniyaṁ abyākataṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca upādānavippayutto anupādāniyo abyākato dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi.🔽Upādānavippayuttaṁ upādāniyaṁ abyākatañca upādānavippayuttaṁ anupādāniyaṁ abyākatañca
analyzed: upādāna vippayuttam anupādāniyam abyākatam dhammam paṭicca upādāna vippayuttaḥ anupādāniyaḥ abyākataḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi  upādāna vippayuttam upādāniyam abyākatam ca upādāna vippayuttam anupādāniyam abyākatam ca
translated: With an object that is unconnected and not connected to clinging, and is neutral, and a state that is unconnected and not connected to clinging, and is neutral, arises. …🔽With an object that is unconnected and not connected to clinging, and is neutral, and a state that is unconnected and not connected to clinging, and is neutral, arises. …

original: dhammaṁ paṭicca upādānavippayutto upādāniyo abyākato dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Hetuyā pañca, ārammaṇe dve …pe… avigate pañca.🔽Upādānagocchakakusalattikaṁ niṭṭhitaṁ.
analyzed: dhammam paṭicca upādāna vippayuttaḥ upādāniyaḥ abyākataḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā 🔽hetuyā pañca ārammaṇe dve pe avigate pañca 🔽upādāna gocchaka kusala ttikam niṭṭhita
translated: With an object that is unconnected and not connected to clinging, and is neutral, and a state that is unconnected and not connected to clinging, and is neutral, arises. …🔽The third section for reciters on skill in aggregates, etc. is finished.
